alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 11:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank and southeastern Currituck Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1114 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Old Trap, or 7 miles southwest of Grandy, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grandy, Sanderling, Old Trap, Point Harbor, Poplar Branch, Spot, Glen Cove, Harbinger, Jarvisburg, Frog Island, Powells Point, Texas, Bertha, Goose Creek, Mamie and Aydlett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck
